Award.AwardTitle: SBIR Phase I: An Intelligent Decision Support System Software for Unconventional Oil and Gas Field Development Design
Award.AbstractNarration:
The broader impact/commercial potential of this Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) project is to replace existing time-consuming numerical tools and inaccurate statistical and analytical methods in unconventional oil and gas field development design with more accurate hybrid models that take advantage of physical properties as well as advanced machine learning methods. The initial tests suggest that such AI software can significantly increase the prediction accuracy and reduce the cost per barrel of produced oil and gas. The results of this research enable oil and gas producers to increase their ultimate oil recovery from their unconventional reservoirs (also known as shale reservoir) by exploring all possible well and completion designs and finding the most optimal one based on multiple criteria.

This STTR Phase I project proposes to develop an intelligent decision support system (IDSS) to optimize unconventional oil and gas field development designs. It is for the first time that a comprehensive IDSS is being proposed in the oil and gas industry for this purpose. The technology behind this software improves the field development design process at three levels. First, a robust predictive model using a hybrid approach (physics-based reservoir engineering, advanced machine learning, and deep learning) makes an accurate and fast production forecast for every potential design. Then, at the optimization level, considering the local subsurface geological uncertainty, the model finds the most optimum field development designs. Eventually, at the highest level, the cognitive unit helps decision makers to find their final design based on their objectives.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

POR.DRECONTENT:
Oil and gas field development design is the process of determining different parameters for the upcoming well drilling projects including but not limited to well locations, number of wells, lateral length, horizontal spacing between wells, target depth and formation, and amount of water and proppant for hydraulic fracturing.

Traditional field development design tools, such as reservoir simulation software, are:

●      Inefficient in cost optimization compared to engineering baseline scenario (up to 10% reduction in cost per barrel)

●      Time consuming (3-4 months per project)

●      Inaccurate in forecasting outcomes

As a result of shortcomings in traditional field development tools, reservoir engineers and managers in the oil and gas companies must settle with a suboptimal design after a long and exhausting process. The suboptimal solution leads to higher break-even price for unconventional oil and gas projects compared to conventional counterparts.

The objective of this NSF SBIR Phase I project was to develop a novel cloud-based artificial intelligence (AI) software to perform unconventional oil and gas field development design. As a result of this project, a Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) solution, called Hurax is developed and tested.

Hurax utilizes an AI-assisted Decision Support System (AI-DSS) for the first time in developing unconventional oil and gas resources. First, a robust grey-box (AI combined with reservoir engineering insight) Predictive Unit makes an accurate and fast production forecast for every potential design. In this approach, a machine learning predictive model considers both well design and subsurface properties to forecast the future production. Then, the software evaluates the future production of all possible designs. Finally, the outcomes of different designs are ranked based on the objectives of the user.

Pilot tests showed that Hurax lowers field development cost (i.e., CAPEX) per barrel by 45%-70%. It means, by leveraging our product, the break-even price of unconventional oil will be around $27-$35 per barrel which makes producing unconventional oil economically viable in a low oil price market. In addition, because unconventional drilling and development projects are fast, it is vital to reduce the planning and design time. NeuDax product shortens the entire design process to less than a week. Also, the prediction error is reduced by %25 (compared to traditional tools) that is crucial for robust economic projections in a narrow margin market like today.
